DataElement.preferredName: Corticosteroid Administered Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator that asks whether the patient is receiving corticosteroids.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The administration of corticosteroids to the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).(NCI)

Concepts.definition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: No systemic or inhaled corticosteroids or immunosuppressive therapy within 30 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy (NOTE: Use of topical corticosteroids and/or eye drops containing glucocorticosteroids is acceptable.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving chronic systemic corticosteroids

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have corticosteroids been discontinued from 7 days prior to first dose of study drug (topical, inhaled or nasal corticosteroids are permitted)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Chronic systemic or regular inhaled corticosteroid use within 7 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Corticosteroids
ReferenceDocuments.description: Corticosteroids

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on a corticosteroid dose greater than physiologic replacement dosing

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the site understand that the patient may take therapeutic doses of steroids during the initial dose escalations & prior to defining a recommended phase II dose?  (This should be recorded in the database.  Once the RP2D has been established, enrollment may be limited based on steroid use.  *Physiologic replacement doses will be defined on this protocol as no more than 0.75 mg/m2/day of dexamethasone or equivalent of steroids.  Doses higher than this will be considered therapeutic.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received systemic corticosteroids within the indicated period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving corticosteroids

ReferenceDocuments.name: Steroids
ReferenceDocuments.description: Steroids

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been on chronic (>1week) immunosuppressive therapy, including corticosteroids (with the exception of physiologic replacement) at the time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been on immunosuppressive therapy, including corticosteroids (with the exception of physiologic replacement, defined as 0.75 mg/m2/day) at the time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the recipient receive corticosteroids?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the recipient receive corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have any Steroid medications been started or stopped this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received systemic dexamethasone continuously at a dose > 8 mg/day for 8 weeks (56 days) prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient require treatment with corticosteroids during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received steroid treatment beyond a maximum of 8 mg/day of dexamethasone (or equivalent) or a total of 8 weeks (56 days) prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the patient on any dose of any systemically administered (oral, rectal, intravenous) corticosteroid within 3 days prior tostep 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving a dose of corticosteroid that is not allowed according to the eligibility criteria for this protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient require treatment with pharmacologic doses of corticosteroids during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF TEXT13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received dexamethasone or other systemic corticosteroids, to treat brain edema and/or brain edema-related symptoms, at a dose greater than 2 mg of dexamethasone (or equivalent) daily within 5 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF TEXT12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient recieving dexamethasone or other systemic corticosteroids, to treat brain edema and/or brain edema-related symptoms, at a dose greater than 2 mg of dexamethasone (or equivalent) daily for less than 5 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is receiving dexamethasone or other systemic corticosteroids for brain edema or brain edema symptoms, is the dose less than or equal to 2mg of dexamethasone (or equivalent) daily for a minimum of 5 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient currently using adrenal steroids?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replace VD Therapy Ind-3 2018278v2.0 with VD ID#3506034 - Yes No Unknown Indicator, set wfs "Released", create new whole number version, effective begin date 7/18/2012  - dbw; Added HCT_BRIDG5 alternate name - RR 2018-12-23
